Another convention that seems to have worked well for other
projects (linux) is to use odd minor version numbers to track
working/developer code, and jump to even minor version numbers
for all actual releases.

Thus as soon as release 0.2 happens, the working branch (HEAD)
is considered 0.3. At some point 0.3.X becomes good enough to
"release", so it becomes 0.4, and the working branch jumps to 0.5,
etc.

- Gordon
